channel.title: PayPal
channel.description:
You need to be 18 or older to activate your Paypal account, I'm 15 and I have a Bank Account... But I cant even Validate my Withdrawal from my bank account because I'm not 18 years or older... Why did I say this?
Just thought Id mention my views on Paypal's Policy Agreement.

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

From a bank account? If I spend more money then I have in that account it will Roll-Back on my father “person who co-signed.”
Anyways lock this post, It’s causing more commotion than needed, Thank you for your views on my PayPal/Bank Accounts/ and Paypal.
Sincerely, Trade Me

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Trade Me:

My parents dont have a Credit Card, And they wouldn’t want money to rollback on them…

You can’t rollback on them with a student account, once it’s empty, it’s empty.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

your account is going to be flagged during tax season and potentially disabled, there is a reason paypal has a strict age limit for U.S. citizens its to protect their own ass when it comes to online currency transfers. Tax evasion is not a joke.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

PayPal is dumb, but if you want an online business, you’ll need to use it (unless you plan on accepting credit card payments, but if it targets RSPS players or younger people, you’re out of luck). Have your parents make you an account. All you have to do is sign up and add a credit card. You can buy and sell items - or at least that’s how it worked with my dad’s account when I was buying stuff off eBay. Adding a credit card is much better than adding a bank account, as it’s instant and when you pay for something, it automatically gets taken out of your bank account (provided it’s a card linked with a bank account). Also, PayPal’s terms require you to be 18 to sign up anyway, so use your parents like I said.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Trade Me:

Yes, That may be so, But by 16 I can have my own bank account.

many banks do not give minors a visa debit card that can be used for online transactions, they give a card that can only be used at an atm

paypals verification system is retarded however, I cannot and have not been able to verify my card and I had a previous card blacklisted, but I have used an unverified paypal account for YEARS with no problems at all

Read full topic
